df-concat
blocks.content: Define the concatenation operator which combines two words. Definition in Section 9.1 of [AhoHopUll] p. 318. (Contributed by FL, 14-Jan-2014.) (Revised by Stefan O'Rear, 15-Aug-2015.)

blocks.name: ccatfn
blocks.content: The concatenation operator is a two-argument function. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 27-Sep-2015.) (Proof shortened by AV, 29-Apr-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm ccatfn() {
  |- wfn(cconcat, cxp(universe, universe))
} = {
  fnmpt2i(hs0, hs1, cconcat, universe, universe, cmpt(hs2, co(nat0, cfzo, co(cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), caddc, cfv(chash, cv(hs1)))), cif(cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs2)), cfv(cv(hs1), co(cv(hs2), cmin, cfv(chash, cv(hs0)))), wcel(cv(hs2), co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(hs0)))))))
  df-concat(hs0, hs1, hs2)
  mptex(hs2, co(nat0, cfzo, co(cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), caddc, cfv(chash, cv(hs1)))), cif(cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs2)), cfv(cv(hs1), co(cv(hs2), cmin, cfv(chash, cv(hs0)))), wcel(cv(hs2), co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(hs0))))))
  ovex(nat0, cfzo, co(cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), caddc, cfv(chash, cv(hs1))))
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(universe)
  diff.hs1.c(universe)
  diff.hs0.s(hs2)
  diff.hs1.s(hs2)
  diff.hs2.c(co(nat0, cfzo, co(cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), caddc, cfv(chash, cv(hs1)))))
}

  eleq2d(cv(s0), co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(hs0))), co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))

  wrdf(c0, c1)
  ffvelrnd(c2, co(cv(hs0), cmin, cfv(chash, c0)), c1, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c2)), wa(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cword(c1)), wcel(c2, cword(c1))), wcel(cv(hs0), co(nat0, cfzo, co(cfv(chash, c0), caddc, cfv(chash, c2))))), wn(wcel(cv(hs0), co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0))))))
  ad3antlr(wcel(c0, cword(c1)), wcel(c2, cword(c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), co(nat0, cfzo, co(cfv(chash, c0), caddc, cfv(chash, c2)))), wn(wcel(cv(hs0), co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)))), wf(c2, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c2)), c1))

  ccatfval(hs0, c0, cword(c1), c2, cword(c1))
  mp1i(wa(wcel(c0, cword(c1)), wcel(c2, cword(c1))), wceq(cfv(chash, cmpt(hs0, co(nat0, cfzo, co(cfv(chash, c0), caddc, cfv(chash, c2))), cif(cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), cfv(c2, co(cv(hs0), cmin, cfv(chash, c0))), wcel(cv(hs0), co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)))))), cfv(chash, co(nat0, cfzo, co(cfv(chash, c0), caddc, cfv(chash, c2))))), wfn(cmpt(hs0, co(nat0, cfzo, co(cfv(chash, c0), caddc, cfv(chash, c2))), cif(cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), cfv(c2, co(cv(hs0), cmin, cfv(chash, c0))), wcel(cv(hs0), co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0))))), co(nat0, cfzo, co(cfv(chash, c0), caddc, cfv(chash, c2)))))

  ifex(cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), cfv(c2, co(cv(hs0), cmin, cfv(chash, c0))), wcel(cv(hs0), co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0))))

  hashfn(cmpt(hs0, co(nat0, cfzo, co(cfv(chash, c0), caddc, cfv(chash, c2))), cif(cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), cfv(c2, co(cv(hs0), cmin, cfv(chash, c0))), wcel(cv(hs0), co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0))))), co(nat0, cfzo, co(cfv(chash, c0), caddc, cfv(chash, c2))))

blocks.name: ccat0
blocks.content: The concatenation of two words is empty iff the two words are empty. (Contributed by AV, 4-Mar-2022.)
blocks.origin:
thm ccat0(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cword(c1)), wcel(c2, cword(c1))), wb(wceq(co(c0, cconcat, c2), emptycls), wa(wceq(c0, emptycls), wceq(c2, emptycls))))

blocks.name: lswccat0lsw
blocks.content: The last symbol of a word concatenated with the empty word is the last symbol of the word. (Contributed by AV, 22-Oct-2018.) (Proof shortened by AV, 1-May-2020.)

blocks.name: ccatalpha
blocks.content: A concatenation of two arbitrary words is a word over an alphabet iff the symbols of both words belong to the alphabet. (Contributed by AV, 28-Feb-2021.)

blocks.name: ccatrcl1
blocks.content: Reverse closure of a concatenation: If the concatenation of two arbitrary words is a word over an alphabet then the symbols of the first word belong to the alphabet. (Contributed by AV, 3-Mar-2021.)

} = {
  3impia(wcel(c0, cword(c1)), wcel(c2, cword(c3)), wa(wceq(c4, co(c0, cconcat, c2)), wcel(c4, cword(c5))), wcel(c0, cword(c5)))

  syl6bi(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cword(c1)), wcel(c2, cword(c3))), wceq(c4, co(c0, cconcat, c2))), wcel(c4, cword(c5)), wcel(c0, cword(c5)), wa(wcel(c0, cword(c5)), wcel(c2, cword(c5))))

  eleq1(c4, co(c0, cconcat, c2), cword(c5))
  syl2an(wcel(c0, cword(c1)), wcel(c2, cword(c3)), wb(wcel(co(c0, cconcat, c2), cword(c5)), wa(wcel(c0, cword(c5)), wcel(c2, cword(c5)))), wcel(c0, cword(universe)), wcel(c2, cword(universe)))
